ARABIC: وَدَّت طَّآئِفَةٌ مِّنْ أَهْلِ ٱلْكِتَٰبِ لَوْ يُضِلُّونَكُمْ وَمَا يُضِلُّونَ إِلَّآ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: A group of the People of the Book would love to misguide you. They only misguide themselves but they are not aware of it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Some among the people of the Book wish to lead you astray, yet they lead none astray but themselves, though they do not realise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: A party of the People of the Book would fain lead you astray, whereas in truth they lead none astray except themselves, but they do not realize it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: A group among the People of the Book would love to mislead you but they mislead no one but themselves. However, they do not realize it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: A group among the People given the Book(s) desire that if only they could lead you astray; and they only make themselves astray, and they do not have sense.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: A party of the People of the Scripture wish to lead you astray. But they shall not lead astray anyone except themselves, and they perceive not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A party of the followers of the Book desire that they should lead you astray, and they lead not astray but themselves, and they do not perceive.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: There is a party of the People of the Book yearn to make you go astray; yet none they make to stray, except themselves, but they are not aware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A party of the People of the Scripture long to make you go astray; and they make none to go astray except themselves, but they perceive not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Some of the People of the Book wish to lead you astray but they only lead themselves astray, though they do not realise it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Pain would a party of the people of the Book lead you astray, and none they lead astray save themselves, and they perceive not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: A group of the People of the Book were eager to lead you astray; yet they lead no one astray except themselves, but they are not aware.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: It is the wish of a section of the People of the Book to lead you astray. But they shall lead astray (Not you), but themselves, and they do not perceive!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: A party of the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) wish to lead you astray. But they shall not lead astray anyone except themselves, and they perceive not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Some of the People of the Book wish to make you go astray, but they lead none astray except themselves, though they do not sense it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: A party of the People of the Book would love to lead you astray, but they only lead themselves astray, and they do not realize it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: A faction of the people of the Scripture wish they could mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they perceive [it] not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [3:69] When the Jews called Mu‘ādh [b. Jabal], Hudhayfa [b. al-Yamān] and ‘Ammār [b. Yāsir] to [join] their religion, the following was revealed: There is a party of the People of the Scripture who yearn to make you go astray; yet they cause none to stray, except themselves, because the sin for their leading [others] astray falls upon them, while the believers do not heed them in this; but they are not aware, of this.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Allah mentions, then, how Ka'b al-Ashraf invited some of the companions of Allah's Messenger (pbuh)- Mu'adh [Ibn Jabal], Hudhayfa [Ibn al-Yaman] and 'Ammar [Ibn Yasir]-to join their religion (Judaism) and 61 leave Islam, after the Battle of Uhud, saying: (A party of the people of the Scripture long to make you go astray) from your Religion, Islam; (and they make none to go astray) from the religion of Allah (except themselves, but they perceive not) this; it is also said that this means: they perceive not that Allah informs His Prophet of this.
